\

\LoggerFilterStringMatch

This is a very simple filter based on string matching.

The filter admits two options \$stringToMatch and \$acceptOnMatch. If there is a match (using \PHP_MANUAL#strpos between the value of the \$stringToMatch option and the message of the [LoggerLoggingEvent](../classes/LoggerLoggingEvent.html), then the \decide() method returns [LoggerFilter::ACCEPT](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_ACCEPT) if the AcceptOnMatch option value is true, if it is false then [LoggerFilter::DENY](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_DENY) is returned. If there is no match, [LoggerFilter::NEUTRAL](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_NEUTRAL) is returned.

An example for this filter: `** File not found : ../../examples/php/filter_stringmatch.php **`

The corresponding XML file: `** File not found : ../../examples/resources/filter_stringmatch.xml **`

Constants

ACCEPT

ACCEPT = 1

The log event must be logged immediately without consulting with the remaining filters, if any, in the chain.

Inherited from
\LoggerFilter

Tags

None found

NEUTRAL

NEUTRAL = 0

This filter is neutral with respect to the log event. The remaining filters, if any, should be consulted for a final decision.

Inherited from
\LoggerFilter

Tags

None found

DENY

DENY = -1

The log event must be dropped immediately without consulting with the remaining filters, if any, in the chain.

Inherited from
\LoggerFilter

activateOptions()

activateOptions()

Usually filters options become active when set. We provide a default do-nothing implementation for convenience.

decide()

decide(\LoggerLoggingEvent  $event) : integer

Decide what to do.

If the decision is [LoggerFilter::DENY](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_DENY), then the event will be dropped. If the decision is [LoggerFilter::NEUTRAL](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_NEUTRAL), then the next filter, if any, will be invoked. If the decision is [LoggerFilter::ACCEPT](../classes/LoggerFilter.html#constant_ACCEPT) then the event will be logged without consulting with other filters in the chain.

Parameters

\LoggerLoggingEvent $event

The {@link LoggerLoggingEvent} to decide upon.
Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in /opt/phpdoc/vendor/twig/twig/lib/Twig/Extension/Core.php on line 1275 Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in /opt/phpdoc/vendor/twig/twig/lib/Twig/Extension/Core.php on line 1275

Returns

integer —

a {@link LOGGER_FILTER_NEUTRAL} is there is no string match.

Inherited from
\LoggerFilterStringMatch

addNext()

addNext(  $filter)

Adds a new filter to the filter chain this filter is a part of.

If this filter has already and follow up filter, the param filter is passed on until it is the last filter in chain.

Parameters

$filter
  • the filter to add to this chain
